paragraph.content: pt received one dose of spironolactone on 2021-11-25 at 1700 and developed a rash, bilateral arms and chest on 2021-11-26.

tr.td:
Patient: PARKER, Michael Daniel MRN: - fin:D9015640038
Age: 51 Years Sex: Male DOB: 1970-12-03
Several months history of tender crusted plaque on the right pretibial area. The pt has not treated the plaque with any topical medications.

CHF, COPD, Diabetes, HTN, MI
Is the patient experiencing pain? Y/N If yes, rate it on pain scale 1-10: _
Pain location: _ Acute/chronic: _
Erythema and 2 + pedal edema right leg. 20 x 15 cm inflamed crusted plaque right pretibial area.

Ordered:
mupirocin topical, 1 Application, Topical, Oint, BID, Routine, Start 2022-02-17 21:00:00 EDT
triamcinolone topical, 1 Application, Topical, Cream, BID, Routine, Start 2022-02-17 21:00:00 EDT
Communication to Nursing
Impression: Infected Eczematous plaque right pretibial area with secondary Cellulitis.
Plan: I will treat the plaque with warm normal saline compresses B I D followed by Mupirocin Oint and Triamcinolone Cream.
Systemic antibiotics to be administered per infectious disease.
I am fairly certain this will cure the pt. I am afraid a skin biopsy will produce a slow healing stasis ulcer and not change our treatment plan.
Should the problem not resolve with systemic antibiotics, soaks and Mupirocin oint and Triamcinolone cream I will gladly biopsy the lesion.

Medications (2) Active
Scheduled: (2)
mupirocin 2% oint 22 g 1 Application, Topical, BID
triamcinolone 0.1% crm 15 g 1 Application, Topical, BID
Continuous: (0)
PRN: (0)
